message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effect of sunlight on objects. When objects absorb sunlight, they tend to heat up or become warmer, not cool, chill, or freeze. Option (D) "blaze up" is incorrect because although objects may become hot, they do not burst into flames or blaze up purely from absorbing sunlight.

Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because absorbing sunlight generally causes objects to heat up, not cool or chill. Option (C) is incorrect because freezing is not a typical outcome of absorbing sunlight.

Option (D) is the correct answer as it accurately describes the effect of absorbing sunlight.
